refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: These routines are used to initialise libglade, and to load addon modules that recognise extra widget sets. The glade_init routine must be called before any libglade routines are used, and the glade_load_module routine would be used to load extra modules.

refsect2.title: glade_init ()
refsect2.para: It used to be necessary to call glade_init() before creating GladeXML objects. This is now no longer the case, as libglade will be initialised on demand now. Calling glade_init() manually will not cause any problems though.

refsect2.title: glade_require ()
refsect2.para: Ensure that a required library is available. If it is not already available, libglade will attempt to dynamically load a module that contains the handlers for that library.

refsect2.title: glade_provide ()
refsect2.para: This function should be called by a module to assert that it provides wrappers for a particular library. This should be called by the register_widgets() function of a libglade module so that it isn't loaded twice, for instance.
